channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Monthly jobs report to be released. And, the White House to host a crypto event
item.description: The Labor Department will release the monthly jobs report card today, which is expected to show solid growth. But that's not the whole picture. And, t...

item.title: The job market is still pretty solid -- but there are warning signs ahead
item.description: U.S. employers added 151,000 jobs in February, while the unemployment rate inched up to 4.1% from 4% in January.

item.title: Federal judge to hear arguments over whether to block immigration arrests in US schools
A South Carolina man is set to become the first executed by firing squad in 15 years
item.description: A South Carolina man convicted of murder is scheduled to be executed by firing squad Friday night. Brad Sigmon beat to death his ex-girlfriend’s paren...

item.title: Paris train services to resume after WW2 bomb defused
item.description: The unexploded bomb was found on tracks near the Gare du Nord on Friday.

item.title: Several dead after UN helicopter shot at in South Sudan
item.description: The shooting during an evacuation mission may constitute a war crime, a UN official says.

item.title: Paul Tazewell on vision behind "Wicked" costume transformation
item.description: From dreaming under Ohio stars to reimagining Oz, Paul Tazewell became the first Black man to win a costume design at the Oscars.

item.title: War heroes are among 26,000 images flagged for removal in Pentagon's DEI purge
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth had given the military until Wednesday to remove content highlighting diversity efforts following an executive order en...

item.title: Worst violence in Syria since Assad fall as dozens killed in clashes
item.description: A group that has been monitoring the civil war said 71 people died in clashes between the two sides.

item.title: Donald Tusk announces military training plan for all Polish men
item.description: Poland's prime minister said his government plans to have a model ready by the end of the year.

item.title: Trump says he's considering Russia sanctions until Ukraine ceasefire is reached
item.description: President Trump said in a social media post that Russia and Ukraine should get to the negotiating table "right now."

item.title: Ros Atkins on... the week after the Oval Office row
item.description: The BBC's Analysis Editor Ros Atkins takes a look at the situation on the ground in Ukraine.

item.title: Investigation advances into Gene Hackman’s mysterious death, with update by New Mexico authorities
Trump threatens Russia with sanctions, tariffs after recent Ukraine attacks
item.description: President Trump is threatening Russia with potential sanctions and tariffs as a response to the recent attacks in Ukraine. This comes as Mr. Trump pus...

item.title: She got her dream job at CDC back. But she's already moving on
item.description: An unknown number of fired CDC workers got their jobs back this week. Among them was Bri McNulty, who had shared her story with NPR.

item.title: Trump says he sent letter to Iran leader calling for nuclear negotiations
item.description: As Iran's nuclear program advances, the country's foreign minister says Tehran won't negotiate under President Trump's "maximum pressure."

item.title: Detroit Zoo's "super fluffy" baby penguin has outgrown his parents
item.description: The baby penguin is just 6 months old and the same weight as an average toddler.

item.title: A look at some of the creative ways companies try to dodge high tariffs
item.description: Companies can try to avoid or minimize tariffs by requesting exemptions or legally reclassifying their products. Here's a look at some of the strategi...
